result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey James Kulas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,294.00 payabel to Tri City National Bank.  To  be paid prior to Court costs/surcharges and assessments.

Court waives costs except for the mandtory costs, surcharges and assessments as defendasnt has a large amount of restitutin to pay and does not have the financial means.
The mandatory court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments  AND RESTITUTION are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

* March 21, 2022/Judge Mark Sanders: Court ordered that the repeater enhancer under WIS. STAT. 939.62(1)(c) shall be removed from the judgment of conviction.*
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
**Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first year of this sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.
Vocational assessment.  Participate in any programs recommended.
Mental health assessment. Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Attend parenting classes.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalzyers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey James Kulas

-  copy to be mailed to defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey James Kulas in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Jeffrey James Kulas in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for  7 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of  4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS,  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $1,294.00 payable to Tri City National Bank to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prinson funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid prior to court costs, surcharges and assessments
-Court waives costs except for the mandatory costs, surcharges and assessments as defendant has a large amount of restitution to pay and  does not have the financial means.  The mandatory Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-Attend parenting classes
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet
ORDER TO PRODUCE

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Jeffrey James Kulas not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informed with a Jury Trial.  Matter rescheduled for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey James Kulas in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Jeffrey James Kulas in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered the penalty enhancer striken.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff's department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Jeffrey James Kulas not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  New offer needs to be discussed with client.  Parties may have resolved this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Produce for Final Pre-Trial on August 13, 2015 @ 1:30 pm received and filed
DEFENDANT'S PROPSED JURY INSTRUCTIONS
Original Transcript (10 pages) commencing 06/09/2015 PRELIMINARY HEARING received and filed.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Jeffrey James Kulas not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested final pre-trial and Jury trial dates. Defense does not get have an offer. Case ajourned to Brach 21.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jeffrey James Kulas in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Jeffrey James Kulas in custody.  Ronald Dague for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense Counsel request sequestration of all State's witnesses.  Sworn for the state:David Anderson-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey James Kulas in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Jeffrey James Kulas in custody.  Ronald Dague, appearing for Megan Carmody, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Due to the lateness of the hour, court cannot commence preliminary hearing on today's date.
Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Clerk:  jms
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY TRI-CITY BANK AND PICK N' SAVE; MILWAUKEE COUNTY LOCATIONS.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Jeffrey James Kulas in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Jeffrey James Kulas in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
